item.title: Nahamcon 2021 - Some Really Ordinary Program
item.description: Binary Exploitation Challenge #file some-really-ordinary-program some-really-ordinary-program: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, stripped # pwn checksec some-really-ordinary-program [*] '/data/nahamcon/pwn/some-really-ordinary-program' Arch: amd64-64-little RELRO: No RELRO Stack: No canary found NX: NX disabled PIE: No PIE (0x400000) RWX: Has RWX segments This is a 64 bit statically linked binary with no standard binary mitigations enabled. Judging by the challenge name, it will require use of Sigreturn Oriented Programming(SROP). I’m fairly new to the concept of SROP so it was a great challenge to practice.
